validation.requiredField: This field is required and cannot be empty.

api.noInternet: You are not connected to the internet.
api.genericError: There was an error. Please try again later.
api.uploadError: There was an error during upload: %{error}

stories.noConnectionSubtitle: Unable to load stories and recordings without a connection.
stories.whatBullet2: Hosted on the web for easy sharing
stories.tellStoriesSubtitle: Create data-driven stories with your recordings and share them on the web.
stories.foundStories: Found %{count} %{noun} you own. Create more from scratch, duplicate an existing Story or start from a template.
stories.uploadRecordingsSubtitle: Upload recordings to Sensor Logger Cloud to be used in Stories.

addStory.templateSubtitle: Start with a pre-made template and customize it to fit the story you want to tell with your data.
addStory.scratchSubtitle: I know what I am doing and I'm familiar with the basics of SQLite.
addStory.duplicateSubtitle: I want to build on top of an existing Story and make it my own.
addStory.footnote: Anyone with the link can view and make copies of your story. Do not put sensitive information.

storyTemplate.instruction: Start from a template and create your own data story.
storyTemplate.footnote: You can also create Stories based on Stories others have made.
storyTemplate.previewFootnote: You can also preview this template using your own recordings. Just visit the link and swap out the data in the Sources.
storyTemplate.visitLink: Visit %{link} in any web browser, preferably on a larger screen or computer.

storyWizard.whatIsStoryDescription: Story is a dashboard tool. It is designed to let you build custom visualisations using recordings made with Sensor Logger.
storyWizard.howDoesItWorkDescription: Upload this recording to Sensor Logger Cloud. Once uploaded, you will have a link to view and build the Story on the web. Only you will have access to any uploaded recording and created Story, unless you share the link with others.
storyWizard.viewExamplesDescription: Tap to view a gallery of example Stories for inspiration.
storyWizard.freeFootnote: Story is free to use. Every user gets 100mb of free Sensor Logger Cloud storage. If you wish to upload more, consider upgrading to one of the paid tiers.
storyWizard.whatsNextDescription: A new Story has been created with this recording attached. Visit this link on any browser to continue. You edit and build your Story there.
storyWizard.storiesTabFootnote: You can always find this link, and all other Stories you own, under the Stories tab in the app.

createStory.intro: Create dashboard-style notebooks using your Sensor Logger recordings to tell data-driven stories, hosted on the web for easy sharing.
createStory.duplicateDescription: Make a copy of an existing story to use as a template for a new one. You can find the 10-digit code at the lower right corner of the Story's page on the web.
createStory.invalidCodeMessage: The code must be 10 characters long.
createStory.titleDescription: Give your story a title. You can change this later.
createStory.descriptionDescription: Describe what your story is about. You can change this later.
createStory.emojiDescription: Choose an emoji to represent your story. You can change this later.
createStory.discardMessage: You have not finished creating your story. Are you sure you want to discard it?
createStory.titleRequiredMessage: Please enter a title for your story.
createStory.descriptionRequiredMessage: Please enter a description for your story.
createStory.tipManaged: Stories are created and managed in the Sensor Logger app, but viewed and edited on the web.
createStory.tipDesktop: While Stories are mobile-compatible, it is designed to be interacted with on a computer.
createStory.tipLink: Anyone with the Story's link can view it, so be careful with sensitive data.
createStory.tipLock: To prevent unwanted edits, you can lock your Story in the Sensor Logger app.
createStory.tipTemplate: Consider creating a Story based on a template to get started.

cloudUpload.instruction: Tap to upload a recording to the cloud. Once uploaded, they can be used for Stories and shared with others.
cloudUpload.noRecordings: No recordings to upload. Recordings will appear here once you have made some.
cloudUpload.keepOpen: Keep Sensor Logger open while uploading to ensure the process completes.
cloudUpload.tooManyConcurrentMessage: Please wait for the current uploads to complete.
cloudUpload.uploadError: This recording could not be uploaded.

appIconScreen.intro: These icons are designed with acceleration data measured on roller coasters using this app. Choose your favourite as you explore the thrills across Europe as seen through sensors.
appIconScreen.customIconsMessage: Subscribe to any paid tiers to unlock custom icons.

storyDetails.deleteStoryMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this Story?
storyDetails.submitAsTemplateMessage: If you think other users may benefit from this Story, you can submit it as a template for others to browse, use and build upon. Your submission will be reviewed.
storyDetails.metaDescriptionInfo: A brief description of the Story.
storyDetails.metaLocked: Locked, meaning it cannot be edited in the browser.
storyDetails.metaUnlocked: Unlocked, meaning it can be edited in the browser, by anyone with the link
storyDetails.metaLockedInfo: Locking a Story prevents it from being edited in the browser. It can still be viewed by anyone with the link.
storyDetails.metaCreatedOnInfo: The date and time the Story was created.
storyDetails.metaUpdatedOnInfo: The last time the Story was updated.
storyDetails.metaPublishedVersionInfo: The currently published version of the Story. You can roll forward and backward to different versions in the Versions menu.
storyDetails.metaFootnote: Edit these details by visiting the Story via the link on any web browser.
storyDetails.openLinkInstruction: Open the link %{link} in any web browser.
storyDetails.scanQRInstruction: Scan or save and share the QR code to view the Story on any device.
storyDetails.regenerateWarning: Anyone with the link can view, share and make copies of your Story. To invalidate previous codes and links, generate a new link.

recordings.noMatchingTags: No recordings match the selected tags.
recordings.deleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete %{count} recordings?
recordings.noCachedExports: No cached exports to delete as no recordings have been exported.
recordings.cacheDeletedMessage: Deleted %{count} cached export files, freeing up %{size} MB of space.

about.reservedColoursMessage: This colour is reserved for subscribers. Subscribe to Sensor Logger to unlock this colour.

sensorSettings.waitingForDataSubtitle: Waiting for values to be reported by the sensors.
sensorSettings.noPlottableDataSubtitle: This Bluetooth data does not contain any plottable fields.
sensorSettings.connectingDevice: Connecting to device for additional data.
sensorSettings.totalAccelerationWarning: Sensor Logger is showing total acceleration (including gravity) as your device lacks the sensors to record acceleration without gravity.
sensorSettings.compassCalibrationWarning: Both 'Compass Calibration' and 'Motion Calibration & Distance' need to be enabled in Settings > Privacy & Security > Location Services > System Services, else data will be reported as 0.
sensorSettings.waitingForSensor: Waiting to receive data from sensor...
sensorSettings.liveReadings: Live readings from this sensor are shown below.
sensorSettings.waitingForAdditional: Waiting for additional data from sensor...
sensorSettings.decodedInfo: Decoded the following information. Tap to copy.
sensorSettings.sensorInfoDescription: The device manufacturer has provided the following information about this sensor. Tap to copy.
sensorSettings.cameraPermission: Waiting for Camera. Check Sensor Logger's camera permissions in the Settings app if this persists.
sensorSettings.watchConnectionReliability: How to improve watch connection reliability?
sensorSettings.standardisationEnabled: Units and coordinates standardisation is on. Tap to learn.

plotsScreen.annotationHint: To add annotations during a recording session, tap the pencil icon on the Logger screen. Press and hold to control the duration.
plotsScreen.timeSeriesPartial: Only showing parts of the time series. To show more points, tap here to decrease resolution
plotsScreen.noImagesSubtitle: No images were recorded during this session. To capture an image, the camera viewfinder must be visible on the screen and the phone screen must be on.
plotsScreen.noMqttData: No MQTT messages were recorded during this session, this could be due to no messages sent or a failure to connect to the broker.
plotsScreen.noSensorData: This sensor did not report any data. This could be due to lack of sensor permissions or a low sampling frequency.
plotsScreen.noSensorDataExtended: This sensor did not report any data. This may be due to lack of permissions, low sampling frequency or an unsupported sensor on this device.
plotsScreen.nothingTriggeredSubtitle: No rules were triggered during this recording session. Rules are evaluated on every new data point, and at least once every minute. You may have also disabled rules logging -- See the advanced settings in Rules Engine.
plotsScreen.showingUpTo100: Showing up to 100 items, please export to see all.
plotsScreen.noPlottableDataSubtitle: This Bluetooth data does not contain any plottable fields.
plotsScreen.noLocation: No location data was recorded during this session.
plotsScreen.reverseGeocodingNotReady: Not ready yet, internet connection required.
plotsScreen.reverseGeocodingFootnote: Reverse geocoding is based on the first coordinates of the recording.
plotsScreen.rulesHint: Every time a rule is triggered, it is logged here. Rules are evaluated on every new data point, and at least once every minute.
plotsScreen.bluetoothSensorsFootnote: %{count} Bluetooth sensors. If a toggled sensor is not appearing here, it might not have advertised during the recording session.

logger.endRecordingConfirm: Are you sure you want to end this recording session?
logger.annotationPanelHint: Tap a preset to log a timestamped annotation, or enter a custom one.
logger.addAnnotationMessage: Record a comment associated with timestamp %{time} and press duration %{duration}ms. Leave empty to only bookmark the timestamp.
logger.locationPermissionMessage: Location access should be set to Always for continuous background measurements, or at least While Using the App for foreground recording.
logger.sensorPermissionMessage: Please enable the permission for this sensor in the Settings app.
logger.orientationOffsetMessage: Sets the angle values to zero for calibration or mounting purposes. Takes effect the moment Set Zero is tapped, and lasts until the end of this recording session. Does not affect other sensors or alter previous orientation readings.
logger.cameraControlsLarge: Tap anywhere on the preview to focus, Pinch to zoom. Use the exposure slider to adjust brightness.
logger.cameraControlsSmall: Tap anywhere on the preview to focus, Pinch to zoom. Expand the camera to see exposure controls.
logger.keepAwakeAlertMessage: This sensor may not work reliably when the screen is off. Would you like to keep the screen on during a recording? You can always change this later in the Settings.
logger.serverErrorMessage: The HTTP Push server responded with an error message: %{message}.
logger.serverErrorCode: The HTTP Push server responded with code 499 indicating a server side error
logger.maxRecordingsReached: Maximum Number of Stored Recordings Reached
logger.maxRecordingsMessage: Sensor Logger can be used for free, for up to 10 locally stored recordings. To continue for free, export and delete some of your existing recordings. Alternatively, consider upgrading to any paid subscription, which unlocks the storing of unlimited recordings amongst other additional features.
logger.noSensorsMessage: No sensors are toggled for this recording. Switch on the sensors you want to log data from.
logger.watchDisconnectedMessage: Watch measurements will not be recorded until the companion watch app is opened.
logger.batteryLevelMessage: The battery level is %{level}%. Sensor Logger may consume high power during recording.
logger.lowStorageMessage: This device has limited storage space remaining, you may wish to free up space.
logger.notConnectedMessage: This recording will only be saved locally. To contribute to the study, you should upload it later from the Recordings page.
logger.uploadToCloud: Upload the recording to Sensor Logger Cloud so the study investigator can download it later.
logger.uploadToBucket: Upload the recording to a storage Bucket that the investigator has setup.
logger.uploadInstructionsDefault: The study investigator has not provided any upload instructions. You may contact the study investigator for more information.
logger.unknownDeliveryMessage: The study investigator has specified an unknown delivery mechanism. You may contact the study investigator for more information.
logger.mqttErrorMessage: An error occurred while setting up the MQTT client: %{error}
logger.tapToScanDevices: Tap to scan for individual devices
logger.bluetoothUpgradeMessage: Upgrade to unlock recording all Bluetooth sensors at once, or scan and enable individual sensors for free.

hintBar.studyActiveMessage: Participating in "%{studyName}". Settings are prescribed. Tap for more.
hintBar.keepAppOpen: Keep the app open until the upload is complete.

settings.troubleshooting: For troubleshooting, tap to visit tszheichoi.com/sensorloggerhelp
settings.sendPhotosSubtitle: Include images in the payload when Camera enabled. Images encoded in base64 string of the JPEG bytes. Video mode not supported.
settings.skipWritingSubtitle: Skip writing data to disk to save space, and only stream to the server. Data is not saved if the transfer fails.

recordingMechanism.confirmBeforeEndingSubtitle: Displays a dialogue when tapping the "End Recording" button to prevent accidental inputs.
recordingMechanism.smartNameSubtitle: Automatically name recordings based on location, if the Location sensor is enabled.
recordingMechanism.keepAwakeSubtitle: Keeps the screen on and prevents the device from locking. Useful for Camera and Bluetooth recordings which may not work in the background.
recordingMechanism.proximityLockSubtitle: Turns the screen off, even if Keep Awake is on, during recording when the proximity sensor is triggered. Avoid accidental inputs and save battery when the phone is in pocket. Otherwise behaves as if the screen is on.
recordingMechanism.inlinePreviewSubtitle: Display live sensor data during recording. May impact performance on resource-constrained devices.
recordingMechanism.inlinePreviewHistorySubtitle: Controls how much data is shown in the inline preview. A longer history may reduce performance.
recordingMechanism.startRecordingOnBootSubtitle: Starts recording when the device boots up. Useful for long term data collection.
recordingMechanism.extraPermissionMessage: To start recording on boot, it must be granted the 'Appear on top' permission. Please grant it on the following screen.

workflow.workflowSubtitle: In classic mode, data is saved in the background for management and exporting when a recording ends. In integrated mode, you'll be prompted to rename and export. Data is always saved regardless. Recordings ended on the watch app always follow the classic workflow.
workflow.cacheNamesSubtitle: When a recording is named in the Integrated workflow, cache the name and location so that future recordings made within ~100m default to it.
workflow.cannotChangeInStudy: You cannot change workflow settings whilst in a study.

timestamps.humanReadableSubtitle: Epoch nanosecond and seconds elapsed are always logged. Additionally log timestamps in human readable format.
timestamps.humanReadableSubscription: You need a paid subscription to enable human readable timestamps. Alternatively, you can parse the epoch timestamps in post-processing yourself.
timestamps.timestampFormatSubtitle: Whether the timestamp column should be in local time or UTC.

clock.infoText: Choose how timestamps are generated for measurements.
clock.deviceClockSubtitle: Use the device clock for timestamps. May drift over time or vary between devices.
clock.networkTimeProtocolSubtitle: Synchronise timestamps to a Network Time Protocol (NTP) server. Useful for aligning measurements across devices.
clock.ntpSubscription: You need a paid subscription to enable NTP Time synchronisation.

checkpoint.checkpointSubtitle: After every 24 hours of continuous recording, that data will be automatically saved as a new entry in the "Recordings" tab seamlessly with no interruption. This helps long-term data collection by organizing daily recordings.

additionalData.uncalibratedValuesSubtitle: Logs raw values from accelerometer, gyroscope and magnetometer. Useful for performing lower level post-processing or custom sensor fusion. Calibrated data is always logged.
additionalData.additionalLocationDataSubtitle: By default, only fused location is logged. Log additional measurements from GPS-only and from network-only.
additionalData.additionalOrientationDataSubtitle: When enabled, the following orientation sensors are recorded:

camera.cameraTypeSubtitle: Which camera to use when the camera sensor is enabled.
camera.cameraModeSubtitle: Capture images at regular intervals, as defined under Sampling Frequencies, or continuously as a single video. To enable sound in video mode, also toggle on the Microphone sensor.
camera.depthNotSupportedInVideo: Depth data is not supported in video mode.
camera.cameraLensOrderSubtitle: Drag to reorder. The first available lens on the device will be used. You can also pinch to digitally zoom in the viewfinder during recording.

microphone.microphoneQualitySubtitle: Lossless has highest quality, but creates larger files. Loudness only logs audio loudness in dBFS, without audio.

location.coordinatesCloakingSubtitle: Reduce coordinates precision for privacy. Round to 0.001° and 0.1° yield ~100m and ~10km precision respectively. If Drop, no coordinates are logged.
location.optimizeForNavigationSubtitle: Sets the location sensor to navigation mode, which uses additional sensors to improve accuracy.

bluetooth.scanningDurationSubtitle: How many seconds to scan for nearby Bluetooth devices when refreshing the list.
bluetooth.rssiThresholdSubtitle: Minimum signal strength during device scanning. An RSSI closer to 0 is stronger. -70 dBm is considered a good signal strength.
bluetooth.decodeValuesSubtitle: If supported, decodes advertised and streamed data. See github.com/tszheichoi/sensor-ble for supported devices.

export.cannotExportInStudy: You cannot export or restore settings whilst in a study.
export.explanatoryText: Settings and the currently toggled set of sensors can be exported using the generated code. This code can be used to restore these settings on the same device or another device. You can share the code with others so they have the same settings when they collect data. Simply forward them the code or ask them to scan the QR code on their phones. Note this excludes Bluetooth sensors due to their device dependent nature.
export.restoreFailedError: Failed to restore settings from clipboard, check the clipboard is correct.

annotationPresets.addAnnotationPresetMessage: This text will be added as an annotation when you tap the corresponding button during a recording.
annotationPresets.presetTooLongMessage: Please keep the annotation text under 100 characters.
annotationPresets.subscribeToAddMorePresetsMessage: Free users can only have a maximum of 3 annotation presets. You can always add an unlimited number of custom annotations during recording. Consider upgrading to any tier to add up to 100 presets.
annotationPresets.maximumPresetsReachedMessage: You can only have a maximum of 100 annotation presets. If you need more, please reach out.
annotationPresets.deleteAnnotationPresetMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this annotation preset?
annotationPresets.infoText: Create annotation presets so you can quickly add timestamped annotations during a recording. You can always add custom annotations during a recording. Useful for marking notable events or activities during the recording for easier post-processing, filtering and analysis. Drag to reorder the presets.

samplingFrequencies.infoText: The sampling frequency for each sensor is device dependent. The true sampling rate may be slower than these values. It is recommended that you examine the output to determine the actual sampling frequency.
samplingFrequencies.cameraWarning: Frequent image sampling may cause performance issues. Setting the Image Quality to 'Lowest' may help. Alternatively, change to Video mode, which bypasses the sampling limitation.
samplingFrequencies.bluetoothWarning: Frequent Bluetooth sampling may cause performance issues when many Bluetooth devices are active.
samplingFrequencies.ruleEngineCallout: Use the rule engine to dynamically change sampling during a recording.
samplingFrequencies.maxLabel: Samples as frequently as possible, subject to device limitations
samplingFrequencies.frequencyPromptMessage: Enter the desired sampling frequency in Hz (samples per second). Enter a value between %{min} and %{max}Hz.
samplingFrequencies.maxFrequencyExceeded: The maximum sampling frequency is %{max} Hz. If you require higher sampling, choose Maximum to sample as frequently as possible.
samplingFrequencies.minFrequencyNotMet: The minimum sampling frequency is %{min} Hz.
samplingFrequencies.periodPromptMessage: Enter the desired sampling period in milliseconds. Enter a value between %{min} and %{max}ms.
samplingFrequencies.invalidPeriodMessage: The sampling period must be between %{min} and %{max} milliseconds.
samplingFrequencies.selectInputTypeMessage: Would you like to enter the sampling frequency (Hz), or the sampling period (ms)?

standardisation.title: Standardise Units & Frames
standardisation.subtitle: Different platforms may report values in different units and coordinate systems, making cross-platform analysis difficult. Turn on to harmonise the definitions across platforms.

sensorFusion.description: Different platforms estimate gravity, user acceleration and orientation using different assumptions and algorithms. Choose a custom filter so that sensor processing is standardised across platforms using an open-source, non-black-box algorithm. Using custom filters require all of the following:

orderSensors.infoText: Drag to change the order in which sensors are displayed. Bluetooth beacons always appear at the bottom.

samplingReference.contributeAnonymouslySubtitle: Help other users understand real-world sampling rates by anonymously contributing your device model's sampling rates occasionally. Only high-level, aggregated statistics of enabled sensors are shared.
samplingReference.viewSamplingReference: To view the Sampling Reference, tap to visit %{url}.

language.contribute: If there are translation errors or if you want to contribute new languages, feel free to reach out.

recordingWorkflow.description: What happens during, when ending and after a recording session.

ruleEngine.title: Rule Engine
ruleEngine.description: Automation rules to trigger sensors, based on measurements, time, location and more.

dataStreaming.title: Data Streaming
dataStreaming.description: Use HTTP & MQTT to push data.

sensorConfiguration.title: Sensor Configuration
sensorConfiguration.description: Settings for cameras, microphones, GPS, bluetooth & uncalibrated data.

standardisation.description: Standardise units and coordinates, and configure custom sensor fusion algorithms.

standardisationFusion.description: Standardise units and coordinates, and configure custom sensor fusion algorithms.

sensorFusion.description: Custom sensor fusion algorithms for gravity, orientation and user acceleration.

samplingFrequencies.description: Control how frequently measurements are sampled.

sensorSections.description: Change the order of sensor sections.

exportShareRestore.description: Use QR code to share settings.

csvZip.description: Export all data to CSV, per sensor, and packages them into a zip file.

json.description: Packages data into a single json file, excluding audio and images.

combinedCsv.description: Resamples, combines and aggregates into a single CSV, aligning all timestamps.

excelSheets.description: Export to .xlsx. Max 10K rows per sensor, organised into worksheets.

kml.description: Export GPS data to a KML file. Only includes location data.

sqlite.description: Export to a SQLite database, organised into tables by sensor. Includes metadata & tags.

missingLocationData.title: Missing Location Data
missingLocationData.message: One or more recordings do not contain location data, and thus cannot be exported to KML.

feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.message: Thanks for using Sensor Logger! We'd love to hear any feedback you have.

confirmDeletion.title: Confirm Deletion
confirmDeletion.message: Are you sure you want to delete %{title}?

alreadyUploaded.title: Already Uploaded
alreadyUploaded.message: This recording has already been uploaded.

hintBar.keepAppOpen: Keep the app open until the upload is complete.
hintBar.uploadToCloud: Please upload this recording to Sensor Logger Cloud. Tap for more.
hintBar.studyNoLongerExists: You made this recording for a study that no longer exists.

investigator.title: I am an Investigator
investigator.subtitle: I would like to create a new study so others can record and share their data with me.

participant.title: I am a Participant
participant.subtitle: I would like to join a study so I can record and share my data with an investigator.

studyActiveAlert.title: Study Active
studyActiveAlert.message: You currently have an active study. You must first deactivate it before creating a new one.

addStudy.tip: Join a study by scanning a QR code provided by the study investigator.

joinStudy.instruction: Ask your study investigator for an eight-digit or QR code to join a study.

cameraPermissionsAlert.title: Camera Permissions
cameraPermissionsAlert.message: You need to grant camera permissions in settings to scan QR codes.

invalidCodeAlert.title: Invalid Code
invalidCodeAlert.message: The study code  provided by the study investigator should be between 6 to 8 characters.

stats.daysRemainingExplanation: Once ended, you will no longer be able to collect data from your participants. You may extend the study duration in the Details tab.
stats.participantsExplanation: Number of participants who have joined your study. You can have up to %{count} participants.
stats.recordingsExplanation: Total number of recordings your participants have successfully uploaded to the cloud.
stats.byobRecordingsExplanation: Since you have configured your own data bucket, Sensor Logger cannot track the number of recordings uploaded. Please check your bucket to see how many recordings have been uploaded.
stats.storageExplanation: You have used %{studyStorage} GB for this study out of %{totalStorage} GB total storage across all studies. Maximum is %{maxStorage} GB.
stats.loadingStats: Loading study statistics, internet connection required.

alerts.deleteStudyMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this study? This action cannot be undone and all data collected will be deleted.
alerts.activeStudyDuplicateMessage: You currently have an active study. You must first deactivate it before duplicating a study.
alerts.activeStudyEditMessage: You currently have an active study. You must first deactivate it before editing a study.
alerts.studyEndedEditMessage: This study has ended and can no longer be edited. You can reactivate it to make changes.
alerts.studyTooOldMessage: This Study has been inactivate for more than 90 days. In accordance to Sensor Logger's data privacy and retention policy, data associated with this Study has already been purged. You will need to create a new Study.
alerts.reactivateSubscriptionMessage: You need to be subscribed to any one of the paid tiers to reactivate a Study. Otherwise, you can duplicate this Study under 'Manage'.

studyDetail.enabledSensorsInfo: The sensors that will be enabled for this study. Some sensors may be disabled if they are not available on your device.
studyDetail.fileFormatInfo: Your data will be stored in this format before being sent to the investigator.
studyDetail.sharingMethodInfo: This is the method by which your data will be sent to the investigator.
studyDetail.privacyStatementInfo: This is the privacy statement provided by the investigator, outlining how your data will be used and protected.
studyDetail.questionnaireInfo: The investigator may use a questionnaire to collect additional information. Questions can be asked when joining the study and at the end of each recording.
studyDetail.rulesInfo: Rules are automation designed by the investigator to collect data based on certain conditions.
studyDetail.webhookInfo: Webhooks allow the investigator to receive real-time notifications when a participant uploads a recording, and optionally provide an analysis report in PDF or markdown format.
studyDetail.notificationsInfo: The investigator may use notifications to remind you to record or upload data. The investigator configures how frequently and when these notifications are sent. You can opt out of these notifications at any time, without affecting your participation in the study.
studyDetail.disclaimer: The content of this study is provided by the study owner. The study and the data collected are not endorsed by Sensor Logger. Please understand the purpose of the study before you contribute.
studyDetail.uploadReminder: You'll be reminded once if you have not uploaded your recording.
studyDetail.recordingReminders: You will also receive start recording reminders:
studyDetail.notificationsToggleInfo: You will only receive reminders when this Study is active. Opt-out by silencing notifications.
studyDetail.notificationsPromptMessage: This study would like to send you notifications, would you like to enable them for this study?
studyDetail.notificationsPromptMessageExtra: If you choose yes, you will then be asked to enable notifications for Sensor Logger.
studyDetail.extendStudyMessage: You can repeatedly extend the duration of a study.
studyDetail.changeStudySizeMessage: Change the size of your study to allow more or less participants to join. If you reduce the size to less than the number of participants currently in the study, no new participants will be able to join.
studyDetail.shareLinkInstruction2: with participants. They will be asked to install the app if they do not already have it installed.
studyDetail.scanQrInstruction: Open the camera app, scan the QR code below and follow the instructions.
studyDetail.openStudiesTabInstruction: Open Sensor Logger to the Studies tab and tap on the 'Create / Join' button. Then tap 'Join a Study'.
studyDetail.investigatorJoinTip: As an investigator, you can also join the study yourself to contribute your own recordings to the study.
studyDetail.leaveStudyTip: You can leave a study at anytime.
studyDetail.ownerMessage: You are the owner of this study.
studyDetail.activateMessage: Activate to start contributing to this study.
studyDetail.recordingMessage: Recordings made while this study is active will conform to the study's configuration.
studyDetail.joinMessage: Join to start contributing to this study.
studyDetail.manageStudyMessage: Delete this Study, or create a new one based on it, inheriting all its descriptions, settings, contacts, questionnaire and more, but not its participants or recordings. During duplication, all local configurations will be overridden by those of this Study.
studyDetail.noRecordingsYet: No recordings yet. Start the study and start recording to see them here.
studyDetail.leaveConfirmation: Are you sure you want to leave this study?

hintBar.studyEndedMessage1: Participants can no longer join or contribute. This Study and uploaded recordings will be deleted 90 days after it ended.
hintBar.studyEndedMessage2: Contact the investigator or leave the study.
hintBar.studyEndedMessage3: Contact the investigator for more information.
hintBar.studyEndedMessage4: It cannot be joined. Contact the study investigator.
hintBar.studyEndedMessage5: Participants can no longer contribute. You may extend the study duration or delete the study.
hintBar.viewingAsInvestigatorMessage: You can view the study as a participant from the Studies screen.
hintBar.viewingAsParticipantMessage: You own this study. View it as an investigator from the Studies screen.

studyDetail.descriptionInfo: What is the purpose of the study, as described by the investigator.
studyDetail.contactInfo: The investigator's contact information. Should you want to learn more about the study, understand how your data is used or request to have your data deleted, you can contact the investigator using this information.
studyDetail.investigatorInfo: The investigator who is running the study.

exportScreen.namingPatternResetMessage: Because you have selected a file format that does not perform any aggregation, the naming pattern has been reset to the default.
exportScreen.advancedExportFormatsMessage: Exporting Combined CSV, Excel, KML or SQLite is only available to paying subscribers.
exportScreen.incompatibleNamingPatternMessage: Because you have selected a file format that does not perform any aggregation, you cannot select a naming pattern that includes aggregators.
exportScreen.customFileNamesMessage: Custom file name is only available to paying subscribers.
exportScreen.footerNote: Local times are determined at the time of export, not at the time of recording. Exports are cached. Reduce the storage usage by periodically using the "Clear Export Cache" button on the Recordings screen, without any risk of data loss.

tagsScreen.bulkModeInstruction: Adding tags to %{count} recordings. Create new tags or tap to assign/unassign tags across all selected recordings.
tagsScreen.singleModeInstruction: Add tags to recordings to help you better organise and filter them. Create new tags, tap to assign and unassign tags.
tagsScreen.tagTooLongMessage: Tags must be less than 20 characters long.
tagsScreen.invalidTagMessage: This tag is reserved for internal use. Please choose another tag.
tagsScreen.deleteTagMessage: This tag is not associated with any other recordings. Would you like to delete it?
tagsScreen.noTagsSubtitle: Add a tag to a recording to help you better organise and filter them.
tagsScreen.bulkModeTip: Tags with a checkmark are applied to all selected recordings. Tags with a dashed border are partially applied. Tap any tag to toggle across all selected recordings.
tagsScreen.singleModeTip: Once a tag has been disassociated from all recordings, it will be deleted.

studiesScreen.joinStudySubtitle: Contribute your recordings to other researchers easily and securely.
studiesScreen.createStudySubtitle: Request data from other Sensor Logger users seamlessly.
studiesScreen.bullet1: Collect data for research in a group
studiesScreen.bullet2: Gather recordings from friends for hobbies
studiesScreen.cloudStorageExplanation: Cloud storage across all your Studies & Stories. Upgrade subscription to increase.

sensors.batteryWarning: High sampling frequency may drain battery quickly.

accelerometer.subtitle: Linear Acceleration
accelerometer.description: Measures the acceleration in the device's coordinate system. The influence of the gravity has been removed. This post-processing is performed by the operating system, not by this app. When available, an additional file named Total Acceleration is recorded, containing the sum of the linear acceleration and the gravitational acceleration vector.
accelerometer.units: Reports in m/s². Always in the device's coordinate system (x, y, z). Assumes g to be 9.80665m/s².

gravity.subtitle: Gravity Vector
gravity.description: Measures the acceleration due to gravity. This is the contribution of the gravitational acceleration vector to the total acceleration vector.
gravity.units: Reports in m/s². Always in the device's coordinate system (x, y, z). Assumes g to be 9.80665m/s².

gyroscope.subtitle: Rotation Rate
gyroscope.description: Measures the device rotation rate in the device's coordinate system.
gyroscope.units: Angular velocity is reported in radians per second in (x, y, z).

orientation.subtitle: Device Orientation
orientation.description: Measures the pitch, roll and yaw of the device with respect to the device's coordinate system. When available, the quaternions are also recorded.
orientation.units: Pitch, roll and yaw are reported in radians. Quaternions are reported in the form of (qx, qy, qz, qw).
orientation.warning: When available, it is recommended that you should use quaternions instead of the pitch, roll and yaw.

magnetometer.subtitle: Magnetic Field
magnetometer.description: Measures the vector of the local magnetic field in the device's coordinate system.
magnetometer.warning: Readings can be influenced by any strong local magnetic field.

compass.subtitle: Magnetic Bearing
compass.description: Measures the compass heading with respect to the device, derived from the local magnetic field. Does not support device tilt compensation, so the device must be held flat.
compass.warning: Readings can be influenced by any strong local magnetic field.

barometer.subtitle: Altitude & Pressure
barometer.description: Measures the barometric altitude above sea level.
barometer.units: Pressure is reported in mbar, and relative altitude is reported in meters since the start of the recording.

bluetooth.subtitle: All Nearby Devices
bluetooth.description: Bluetooth is a wireless technology standard used for exchanging data between fixed and mobile devices over short distances.
bluetooth.frequency: Dependent on bluetooth device, usually as frequently as the device advertises itself.
bluetooth.units: The Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) is measured in dBm. A greater negative value indicates a weaker signal. The manufacturer's data is logged raw to maximise compatibility. You have to decode it yourself.
bluetooth.warning: Bluetooth data is recorded only when the app is open and the screen is on. Some information is only available from bluetooth devices which are paired to your phone. All commas in the names are replaced with dashes; In CSV exports, comma separated lists are delimited by pipes.
bluetooth.deviceDescription: %{name} is a nearby Bluetooth device. This device %{connectableStatus}. The full device ID is %{id}.
bluetooth.deviceWarning: Bluetooth data is recorded only when the app is open and the screen is on. You may have to pair this device in your phone's settings to view more information, such as its name. All commas in the names are replaced with dashes; In CSV exports, comma separated lists are delimited by pipes.
bluetooth.bluetoothPermissionMessage: You need to grant Bluetooth permissions in settings to use this feature.

location.subtitle: GPS Coordinates
location.description: Measures the GPS coordinates and altitude. Longitude and latitude are reported in degrees. Unless otherwise stated in the exported data, altitude refers to the ellipsoidal altitude (WGS84). In some cases, the altitude above mean sea level is also reported. Also logs speed and bearing.
location.units: Latitude is in degrees, with positive values indicating locations north of the equator (within -90 to 90 degrees), while longitude, also in degrees, uses positive values to denote locations east of the meridian line (within -180 to 180 degrees). Altitude is in meters, and is the height above the WGS84 ellipsoid. Bearing, in degrees from 0 to 360, is the direction relative to due north, with negative values indicating invalid data. Bearing accuracy, also in degrees, represents the accuracy of the bearing measurement, with negative values denoting invalid data. Horizontal and vertical accuracies are in meters. Speed and Speed accuracy are both in meters per second.
location.warning: The accuracy of the GPS sensor is dependent on the signal strength.

camera.subtitle: Images or Video
camera.description: Captures images at set intervals or continuously as a video from the device camera, depending on the Camera Mode in settings. If the mode is set to Images, the captured images are timestamped and synchronized with other measurements. If the mode is set to Video, a single video file is created. By default it has no audio track, but if the Microphone sensor is also enabled, audio will be included. See the documentation on how to align video timestamps with other sensor data. In either case, you can choose to use the front or rear camera, and set a lens preference (Wide, Ultra Wide, Telephoto) if your device supports multiple lenses.
camera.units: in JPG format (Image Mode) or MP4 format (Video Mode).
camera.warning: To capture images or videos, the camera viewfinder must be visible on the screen and the phone screen must be on. When images are captured, your device may play a shutter sound. Mute your device to prevent this, especially if the Microphone sensor is enabled.

heartRate.subtitle: From Paired Watch
heartRate.description: Measures the heart rate in BPM from the companion watch app. The watch app must be in the foreground when the recording starts for the heart rate measurement to begin. The watch app may go into the background subsequently and the measurement will continue.
heartRate.frequency: Not configurable. The sampling rate can be unpredictable. There may be a long delay before the first measurement arrives.
heartRate.warning: For this sensor to work, you will need to grant the permission to heart rate measurements on the watch.
heartRate.warningIos: This can be done on the watch in Settings > Health > Apps > Sensor Logger.
heartRate.warningEnd: This app will only monitor the heart rate sensor and does not read other health data on your phone. It will also not write any health data.

wristMotion.subtitle: From Paired Watch
wristMotion.description: Logs motion related readings from your watch on your wrist. This includes the rotation rate (in x, y and z), gravity vector (in x, y, and z), acceleration (in x, y, and z) and the attitude in quaternion.
wristMotion.units: Same units as the corresponding sensors on the phone.
wristMotion.warning: These sensors will always work if the watch app is in the foreground with the watch screen on. If you want background recording, you must also enable the heart rate sensor and grant the relevant permissions. This indirectly enables background recording of wrist motion data.

watchLocation.subtitle: From Paired Watch
watchLocation.description: Logs locations readings from your watch on your wrist.
watchLocation.units: Same units as the corresponding sensors on the phone.
watchLocation.warning: These sensors will always work if the watch app is in the foreground with the watch screen on. If you want background recording, you must also enable the heart rate sensor and grant the relevant permissions. This indirectly enables background recording of location data.

watchBarometer.subtitle: From Paired Watch
watchBarometer.description: Logs barometer readings from your watch on your wrist.
watchBarometer.frequencyIos: Approximately Once Every 2.5 seconds (0.4Hz). Not configurable.
watchBarometer.frequencyAndroid: Depends on device model. Not configurable.
watchBarometer.units: Same units as the corresponding sensors on the phone.
watchBarometer.warning: These sensors will always work if the watch app is in the foreground with the watch screen on. If you want background recording, you must also enable the heart rate sensor and grant the relevant permissions. This indirectly enables background recording of barometer data.

watchMagnetometer.subtitle: From Paired Watch
watchMagnetometer.description: Logs magnetometer readings from your watch on your wrist.
watchMagnetometer.frequencyAndroid: Depends on device model. Not configurable.
watchMagnetometer.units: Same units as the corresponding sensors on the phone.
watchMagnetometer.warning: These sensors will always work if the watch app is in the foreground with the watch screen on. If you want background recording, you must also enable the heart rate sensor and grant the relevant permissions. This indirectly enables background recording of magnetometer data.

watchCompass.subtitle: From Paired Watch
watchCompass.description: Measures the compass heading with respect to the watch.
watchCompass.frequencyAndroid: Depends on device model. Not configurable.
watchCompass.warning: Readings can be influenced by any strong local magnetic field. These sensors will always work if the watch app is in the foreground with the watch screen on. If you want background recording, you must also enable the heart rate sensor and grant the relevant permissions.

microphone.subtitle: Audio & Level
microphone.description: Returns an audio recording that is timestamp synchronized against other measurements. Also returns loudness measure in dBFS (Decibels relative to full scale), where the level of 0 dBFS is the maximum possible digital level. See wikipedia.org/wiki/DBFS for more information.
microphone.frequency: You may change the compression between lossy and lossless using the gear icon next to the Start Recording button. The sampling frequency for the loudness cannot be adjusted.
microphone.units: Loudness in dbFS. The audio is in .mp4, the sampling rate varies depending on the configuration.
microphone.warning: Note that Sensor Logger always uses the microphone on your phone, not from any connected headsets.

light.subtitle: Ambient Brightness
light.description: Measures the relative ambient brightness using the ambient light sensor.

pedometer.subtitle: Step Count
pedometer.description: Logs the number of steps taken since the start of the recording session. This is calculated by the operating system, not by Sensor Logger.
pedometer.warning: There may be a delay of several seconds before a step is counted. As such, please make sure your recording is long enough to capture all the steps you want to count.

headphone.subtitle: AirPods Motion
headphone.description: Logs motion readings from your AirPods wireless Bluetooth earbuds. You can use this for applications such as head tracking. This includes the acceleration (in x, y, and z), gravity vector (in x, y, and z), rotation rate (in x, y, and z) and the attitude. Due to limitations only one earbud records motion data at a time. The active earbud is indicated by the sensorLocation field.
headphone.frequency: Not configurable and variable, up to 25Hz on the latest models and 15Hz on older models.
headphone.units: Same units as the corresponding sensors on the phone.
headphone.warning: You must be wearing your paired AirPods -- you can wear both or just one of the earbuds. If you turn off 'Automatic Ear Detection' in the AirPods settings, it is possible to record the motion of the AirPods when they are not in your ears as long as they are connected to your phone.

battery.subtitle: Battery Level
battery.description: Measures the battery level of the device. Also logs the battery state (charging, full, etc.). Negative value means the battery state is unknown.

batteryTemp.subtitle: Battery Temperature
batteryTemp.description: Measures the battery temperature of the device.

brightness.subtitle: Screen Brightness
brightness.description: Measures the brightness of the device's screen. This is useful for determining if the screen is on or off. If auto-brightness is enabled, on supported devices, these values can also act as a proxy for the ambient brightness.

network.subtitle: Type & Quality
network.description: Reports information about the type of network connection and its quality. This includes the type of network (e.g. WiFi, cellular) and more. This could also be used as a proxy for the device's location, especially if the GPS sensor is not available.
network.units: Type can be one of none, unknown, cellular, wifi, Bluetooth, ethernet, wimax, vpn or other. Strength is a number between 0 and 100. IP address is the external IP address. Can be IPv4 or IPv6. Frequency is the network frequency. For example, 2.4GHz will return 2457. Cellular generation can be one of 2g, 3g, 4g, 5g or null.

wifi.subtitle: Nearby Networks
wifi.description: Reports information about nearby WiFi networks. This includes the SSID & frequency.
wifi.units: SSID is the name of the WiFi network. BSSID is the MAC address. Frequency is the network frequency. For example, 2.4GHz will return 2457. Capabilities is a list of capabilities of the network. Level is the signal strength in dBm.

activity.subtitle: Walk, Run, Drive
activity.description: Tracks motion activity such as walking, running, cycling or driving since the start of the recording session. This is estimated by the operating system, not by Sensor Logger.
activity.frequency: Event driven, meaning that new data is only recorded when there is a change in activity. Not configurable.
activity.units: Activity type can be one of walking, running, cycling, automotive, stationary, tilting or unknown. Confidence can be one of low, medium, high or unknown.

stateAlerts.sensorsUnavailableMessage: The following sensors are unavailable and were not set: %{sensors}.
stateAlerts.incompleteRestorationMessage: Some settings were not restored because the configuration contains features that are only available in the pro version. Please consider upgrading to the pro version to restore the full configuration.
stateAlerts.feedbackMessage: We noticed that you have unsubscribed from Sensor Logger. We'd love to hear your feedback on how we can improve Sensor Logger. Would you like to provide feedback?
